modName: ENB SubSurface Scatering red glowing body fix
summary: Fix the annoying red body glow from sss in the dark
descriptionHtml:
I was really annoyed with the way SSS work with texture that I found, keep in mind that this is what I wanted to get from SSS , very light tint change and some light bleed for the ears and hands, maybe I'll do the toes later

There might be seams that appears on very very light skin tone. It was a real pain to fit the layer properly. I'm not a pro drawer just have a little bit of time to have fun tweaking.

What I did, use alpha channel on a skin tone and named it _sk

As was said on enb forum this texture for sss NEEDs to be Alpha channel, not red, rainbow or black and white. With that in mind I use Dmonized UNP base skin for the body as a base texture to see where is what, and for the heads I used I think it's fair skin as a base to fit the alpha properly, this doesn't change anything for the skin you use texture you use as long as the placement is the same.


[size=4][b]Installation:[/b][/size]
Use Mod Organiser ( it make thing so simple)
Load after the skin you use

[size=4]Setup:[/size]
On my screen shot the skin I use is a modified fair skin to be even lighter tone
Keep in mind that the darker the skin tone the less the effect is visible, you'll need to push the ENB setting futher


[size=4]Compatibility:[/size]
Should be Compatible with any UNP, UNPB ,7base skin since they use the same texture base
I quickly tried CBBE it looked like it worked

For Male character, copy those file to the male directory and rename them to male_1_sk.dds
it should make them stop glowing also


Tell me what you think, thx

My ENB setting in SSS

[SUBSURFACESCATTERING]
IgnoreWeatherSystem=true
EnableTextureAlpha=true
Quality=0
Radius=3.0
Amount=0.66
EpidermalAmount=15.0
SubdermalAmount=25.0
EpidermalDiffuseSaturation=0.5
SubdermalDiffuseSaturation=1.0
EpidermalMix=0.5
SubdermalMix=0.5
SubdermalTranslucency=1.0
SubdermalPhase=0.0

this is use for the screen shot
